verses.roman:
ācārya-kalpita artha,--ihā sabhe jāni
sampradāya-anurodhe tabu tāhā māni

synonyms: ācārya—Śaṅkarācārya; kalpita—imaginative; artha—meaning; ihā—this; sabhe—all of us; jāni—know; sampradāya-anurodhe—but for the sake of our party; tabu—still; tāhā—that; māni—we accept.
translation: "We know that all this word jugglery springs from the imagination of Śaṅkarārārya, and yet because we belong to his sect, we accept it although it does not satisfy us.
